decks.notes: The main concept of this Legacy Combo-Infect deck is to quickly put pressure on the opponent using efficient infect creatures like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent, while protecting them with countermagic like Daze and Force of Will. The deck also utilizes pump spells like Invigorate and Berserk to increase the infect damage output and close out the game quickly. The deck is able to control the board with cards like Vines of Vastwood and Spell Pierce, while also digging for combo pieces with Brainstorm and Gitaxian Probe. The mana base is streamlined to support the aggressive game plan.

This deck focuses on leveraging efficient creatures and disruptive spells to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan. By playing disruptive cards like Hymn to Tourach, Thoughtseize, and Liliana of the Veil, along with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze, the deck aims to control the game while aggressive threats like Tarmogoyf and Delver of Secrets put pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's resources and game plan while applying pressure to close out the game quickly.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure through efficient creatures. By utilizing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's spells and mana development. Cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Aether Vial help to quickly get powerful equipment into play, allowing for a quick clock to be put on the opponent. With a mix of disruption and aggression, this Death & Taxes deck aims to control the game and outpace the opponent with efficient creatures and equipment.

The deck focuses on filling the graveyard quickly with cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Grave-Troll, using cards like Faithless Looting and Careful Study. This enables powerful graveyard interactions such as bringing back creatures with Dread Return and creating Zombie tokens with Bridge from Below. The deck aims to win by assembling a combo involving sacrificing creatures like Narcomoeba and Ichorid to generate mana with Lion's Eye Diamond and then reanimating a game-ending threat like Griselbrand or Flame-Kin Zealot.

This deck focuses on utilizing the elves' abilities to generate mana quickly and efficiently, while also drawing cards with Glimpse of Nature to keep the combo going. The main win condition is to use Natural Order to search for Craterhoof Behemoth and swing for lethal damage in one turn. The deck also has disruption in the form of Deathrite Shaman and Scavenging Ooze to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast, explosive combo while maintaining card advantage.

The main concept of this Legacy Control - Loam deck is to utilize the synergy between cards like Dark Confidant, Knight of the Reliquary, and Life from the Loam to create a strong engine for card advantage and resource recursion. The deck aims to control the game with cards like Chalice of the Void, Abrupt Decay, and Liliana of the Veil while also having a strong land denial strategy with Wasteland and Punishing Fire. The deck is able to tutor for key pieces with Green Sun's Zenith and has versatile options for different situations with a mix of utility lands and disruptive creatures.

The primary strategy of this Legacy 1 vs 1 Patriot Aggro deck is to quickly establish board presence and control through efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and True-Name Nemesis, backed up by disruptive spells such as Lightning Bolt, Force of Will, and Spell Pierce. The deck also utilizes powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Batterskull to further strengthen its creatures and push for damage. By efficiently deploying threats and disrupting the opponent's game plan, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this Legacy deck is to quickly and efficiently bring out powerful creatures such as Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn using the combo card Show and Tell. By utilizing cards like Sneak Attack and Lotus Petal to cheat these creatures into play, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its high impact threats in a short amount of time. With a mix of countermagic and card draw spells, the deck aims to disrupt opponents while also maintaining consistency in its plays.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the necessary cards to generate a large amount of mana and draw through the deck using various cantrips. The goal is to set up the combo finish by casting powerful sorceries like Ad Nauseam or Past in Flames to generate a lethal Tendrils of Agony. The deck utilizes a mix of rituals, card draw, and disruption to efficiently execute the storm mechanic and win the game in a single explosive turn.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Monastery Swiftspear to pressure the opponent early on. It also includes efficient spells like Lightning Bolt, Daze, and Force of Will to control the board and protect your creatures. The deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Gitaxian Probe and Treasure Cruise to draw more cards and maintain momentum. Overall, this deck excels at applying early pressure, disrupting the opponent's strategy, and maintaining card advantage to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through card advantage, counterspells, and removal spells, while setting up powerful win conditions such as Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Entreat the Angels. The deck focuses on manipulating the top of the deck with cards like Sensei's Divining Top and Counterbalance to control the flow of the game and ensure that the opponent's threats are dealt with effectively. By consistently answering threats and digging for powerful cards, this deck aims to grind out the opponent and secure victory through careful and calculated plays.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and efficient creatures like Young Pyromancer, Stoneforge Mystic, and True-Name Nemesis. The deck also aims to generate card advantage with spells like Brainstorm, Ponder, Gitaxian Probe, and Treasure Cruise. Additionally, the deck includes equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Batterskull to provide additional threats and combat abilities. With a mix of control elements and aggressive threats, this deck aims to outmaneuver and overwhelm opponents in a Legacy 1 vs 1 format.
